children.subject: This is for the L&S CS major. No policies have changed for the EECS major.
Where might I find the EECS major policies?
Are these 3 CS upper divs or does it have to include one from the 6 upper division units outside your major?

Gustavo, 


The department has no policy limiting the number of courses a student may transfer to fulfill a requirement. I'm not sure if your college does, but they don't mention it here: https://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/study-abroad/study-abroad-faqs. I would check in with your ESS Advisor. In regards to getting courses approved "Students who want to take technical courses for their major while on study abroad should get the syllabi and have Berkeley faculty review it beforehand. The official evaluation of the courses will be done when the student returns. Students must bring the syllabi and course descriptions to their ESS adviser, who will give them the course evaluation forms and instruction on how to have the courses reviewed.". These then come to me.
@KB, this post is only about LSCS Major requirements and therefore is talking about EECS upper divisions.
Is this for EECS upper divs? Or does it also limit the H/SS requirements that can be fulfilled?
We're looking at the end of the month. So far this year, our priorities have been advising students, admitting new majors, and graduating December graduates.
is there an eta on the study abroad section of the website?

history.content:
Update: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/study-abroad

For the CS major, students may transfer up to 3 upper divs (if equivalent)

For the EECS/CS minors, students may transfer up to 2 upper divs (if equivalent)

we will be making a study abroad section on the webpage sometime in the near future
history.subject: new policy regarding transferring study abroad courses
